attributes.title: Debut Trailer
attributes.description: Get your Team Fat apron by supporting us the month of October 2017 on http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny at the fan mail tier!Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub...Support us and get EVERY episode of Cooking with Greggy one week early: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnyGet your Cooking with Greggy shirt here: http://www.kindafunny.com/storeSEARED STEAK OVER ARUGULA INGREDIENTSSteakArugulaOlive OilPepperSteak seasoning of your choiceButterParmesanSEARED STEAK OVER ARUGULA STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS1) Put a bed of arugula on the plate or plates. Pepper it and drizzle some olive oil.2) Put you cast iron skillet on the stove at medium high.3) Take the steaks -- which should be at room temperature or at least have been out of the fridge a bit -- and season them to your liking.4) Toss a knob of butter in the skillet and spread it around.5) Toss the steak in there. Let it cook for 3 minutes if you want a rare steak like me. Four for medium rare. Any longer than that and you are a crazy person who wants to ruin steak.6) Flip it. Let it cook for the same amount of time you let the first side cook for.7) Pull it off and let it rest a spell on the cutting board.8) Cut it up into strips. 9) Put it over the salad, sprinkle some Parmesan, and you have a classy ass date meal.Follow us on Twitter!Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggyNick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_ScarpinoKinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

attributes.title: How to Make Firehouse Chicken
attributes.description: Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub...Get Cooking with Greggy one week early: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnyBuy the Cooking with Greggy Shirt: http://www.kindafunny.com/storeFIREHOUSE CHICKEN STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS1) Purée garlic, vinegar, olive oil, salt, parsley, paprika, pepper, and ½ cup vegetable oil in a blender until smooth. Don’t got a blender? Chop it up, kid. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over. Seal bag and chill chicken overnight.2) Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Let sit uncovered at room temperature 1 hour.3) Preheat oven to 400. Coat the cast-iron skillet with olive oil and place the chicken skin down in it. Put the skillet (with the chicken already in it) on the stove at medium-high heat. Cook until skin is browned and crisp, 15 to 20 minutes. Flip it over, kid!4) Roast chicken in oven, skin side up, until cooked through and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of thigh registers 165°, 20–25 minutes. Original Bon Appetit Recipe: https://www.bonappetit.com/recipe/fir...INGREDIENTS FOR FIREHOUSE CHICKEN4 garlic cloves, chopped2 cups distilled white vinegar½ cup olive oil¼ cup kosher salt2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley2 tablespoons paprika1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper1 cup vegetable oil, divided2 Bone-in chicken thighs2 Bone-in chicken breastsBRUSSELS SPROUTS STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS1) Preheat oven to 400 degrees.2) Got a bunch of Brussels sprouts? Wash’em, peel off the yellow leaves, cut off their butts, and cut’em in half.3) Place the sprouts in a plastic bag, pour enough olive oil to coat them, and season with salt and pepper. Seal tightly, shake to coat. Pour onto a baking sheet, and place on center oven rack.3) Roast in the preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes, shaking pan every 5 to 7 minutes for even browning. Reduce heat when necessary to prevent burning. Brussels sprouts should be darkest brown, almost black, when done. Adjust seasoning with kosher salt, if necessary. Serve immediately.Original Recipe: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/67952/ro...INGREDIENTS FOR BRUSSELS SPROUTSBrussels SproutsOlive OilSaltPepper(You eyeball all of this. Don’t fret. Have fun.)FARRO STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS1) Boil a shitload of water.2) When the water’s boiling, toss the farro in.3) Strain it.4) Bam -- that’s a great side.INGREDIENTS FOR FARROA shitload of water1 cup of farroFollow us on Twitter!Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggyNick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_ScarpinoKinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVidsEvery Monday for 8 weeks, Greg's bringing you a dish so easy HE could cook it.

attributes.title: Kickass Ribs from the Oven
attributes.description: Get your Team Fat apron by supporting us the month of October 2017 on http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny at the fan mail tier!Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub...Support us and get EVERY episode of Cooking with Greggy one week early: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnyGet your Cooking with Greggy shirt here: http://www.kindafunny.com/storeINGREDIENTS OF RIBSBaby Back RibsBBQ SauceRub Rub (Can be just salt and pepper if you like)STEP BY STEP INSTRUCTIONS (RIBS)1) When you buy the ribs, ask the butcher to remove the membrane. If you don’t have a butcher, remove the membrane when you get home. This is the white film/skin on the back of the ribs. Just slide your knife under there and then pull with your fingers. This too weird for you? Fuck it. Just makes the ribs more tender. You’ll survive if you don’t do it.2) Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. 3) Line a glass pan with aluminum foil.4) Season the ribs with you rub.5) Place the ribs in the pan and add some water to it. About a fourth of an inch.6) Cover the pan with aluminum foil, and put them in the oven for an hour.7) After that hour, pull the pan out, take off the top, increase the temperature to 375, and cook for 15 more minutes.8) Pull the pan out, slather on some sauce, and broil on high until the sauce is bubblin’ good (five minutes tops).9) Cut’em up, add more sauce, and serve INGREDIENTS FOR COLESLAWHalf a Red cabbageHalf a Green cabbage3 CarrotsWhite wine vinegarVegetable OilOnion saltCelery saltGarlic powder½ a lemon’s juiceSugarSalt and Pepper1 tbsp grilled or black sesame seedsSTEP BY STEP INSTRUCTIONS (COLESLAW)1) Remove outer leaves of red & green cabbages, rinse2) Slice cabbage thinly and take apart with fingers3) Wash and shred the carrots4) Mix everything in large serving bowl, set aside. 5) In a mason jar or other container with a lid, add 1 tablespoon vinegar for 3 tablespoons oil (increase quantities if larger portion is being served). Toss in lemon juice and seasonings, sugar. Shake well.5) Pour dressing on salad only when about to serve, mix well. Top with sesame seeds. INGREDIENTS FOR MAC AND CHEESE4 cups elbow macaroni (or short pasta of your choice, ideally curved) 5 tbsp unsalted butter4 cups milk2 tbsp all purpose flour½ cup accent cheese (the strong/pungent one, like aged gouda or sharp cheddar) 1/2 cup grated gruyere, plus ½ cup in big chunks1 cup grated fontina½ tsp grated nutmeg½ cup panko crumbsSTEP BY STEP INSTRUCTIONS (MAC AND CHEESE)1) Get a solid 3-cheese foundation. One pungent (aged gouda or sharp cheddar), one mild (gruyere), one that melts really well (fontina). Grate it all. Drain and toss with 2 tbsp butter. Set aside.2) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.3) Cook pasta in a large pot of salted, boiling water (about 5-7 minutes)4) Make a roux: In a large pot over medium heat add 2 tablespoons butter and the flour. Cook, stirring, for about 2 to 3 minutes; don't let the roux color. 5) Pour milk onto the roux, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. Cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes until the sauce is thick.6) Add grated nutmeg to the sauce and stir.7) Remove from the heat and add the aged gouda, 1/2 the grated gruyere and 1/2 the fontina; stir until melted and smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.8) Pour mix over the pasta, add the chunks of gruyere, and mix until well blended. Put into the prepared baking dish. 9) Sprinkle the remaining gruyere and fontina cheeses evenly over the top, add a little bit of panko for coloring. 10) Bake until the top is golden and crusty, about 25 to 30 minutes.Follow us on Twitter!Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggyNick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_ScarpinoKinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

attributes.title: Make these Mussels, Fries
attributes.description: Get your Team Fat apron by supporting us on patreon.com/kindafunny at the fan mail tier during the month of October!Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub...Support us and get EVERY episode of Cooking with Greggy one week early: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnyGet your Cooking with Greggy shirt here: http://www.kindafunny.com/store***Full Recipe***Serves 2 peopleMUSSELS INGREDIENTS:- 2 pounds of mussels (one per person, scrubbed & debearded (foot removed))- 1/2 stick of butter- 2 small shallots (or both pieces of a medium one), finely chopped- 4-5 cloves of garlic, thinly sliced - 1/2 cup of dry white wine (Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Grigio)- 1/4 cup of heavy cream - 2 sprigs of fresh thyme- Kosher salt & freshly ground pepper- Loaf of crusted white bread- 1/2 stick of butter for browning breadMUSSELS STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS: Melt half a stick of butter in large pan on medium heat, then cook garlic and shallots until softened but not browned (a couple minutes, stirring frequently). Deglaze with white wine, add sprigs of thyme and bring to a boil. Add mussels, cover pan with lid. Steam for 4-5 minutes or until mussels start opening up, gradually transferring them to shallow serving bowls as they open. After 8-10 minutes, discard any that have not opened. Once all mussels have been taken out of the pan, add cream and stir, bringing sauce to a simmer. Season with salt & pepper, and ladle mix onto mussels in serving bowls. Serve with buttered, charred slices of crusted bread, fries on the side. FRIES INGREDIENTS- Canola oil for frying (enough to submerge fries in a deep pan) - 2 yukon gold potatoes, cut in long sticks- Kosher salt- Pepper- Rosemary or other herbs if you're feeling crazy.FRIES STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS1) Dice dem taters into sticks. Y;know, the size of fries you'd wanna eat.2) Toss the finished sticks into a bowl of cold water to destarch them. Dump out the cloudy water, put more cold water in. Repeat until the water in the bowl is no longer cloudy.3) Over in your cast iron skillet, dump in a good layer of canola oil. You want to submerge the fries, but you don't need to overdo it. Heat over medium high.4) While the oil is heating up, pull the fries out of the water and put'em on a clean towel. Pat them dry.5) OK, the oil's hot? Great. Put the fries in carefully. Don't overcrowd. You'd going to do this in batches.6) Once the fries change texture (they'll go from glossy to matte), pull them out and put them on a paper towel.7) Put in the next batch. Do it again.8) OK, start tossing in the partially fried fries. Let'em go until they're the brown and crispy fries you like. 9) Pull'em out, toss'em back on a paper towel, and salt, pepper, and herb those bad boys.10) Serve!Follow us on Twitter!Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggyNick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_ScarpinoKinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids
